Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Plantaricin 163 (natural AMPs; bacteriocins, Gram-positive bacteria; prokaryotes)

Literature Information.Literature: Showed 34% similarity to Hyfl J (AP1091). Active against S. aureus, L. monocytogenes, B. pumilus, B. cereus, M. luteus, L. thermophilus, L. rhamnosus, E. coli, P. aeruginosa, and P. f luorescens.
Literature Information.Author: Hu M, Zhao H, Zhang C, Yu J, Lu Z.2013
Literature Information.Reference: J Agric Food Chem. 2013 Nov 27;61(47):11676-82.Pub-Med;Precursor sequence GenBank
Literature Information.Title: Purification and Characterization of Plantaricin 163, a Novel Bacteriocin Produced by Lactobacillus plantarum 163 Isolated from Traditional Chinese Fermented Vegetables.
